investigations.name: The Waterwheel Mystery
investigations.description: Investigate why the Old Mill's waterwheel has stopped turning

intro.introNarrative: The great waterwheel stands eerily still, water flowing past unused. The silence where grinding stone should echo is unsettling. Something is clearly wrong—and someone needs to investigate.

phases.name: Examine the broken gear mechanism
phases.description: Carefully inspect the waterwheel mechanism to understand what went wrong
phases.outcomeNarrative: The gear teeth show clear marks of deliberate damage. This was no accident—someone wanted the mill to stop working. The scoring pattern suggests a chisel or similar tool, wielded with intent to disable but not destroy completely.

phases.name: Question Elena about who has access to tools
phases.description: Speak with Elena about what she knows regarding the waterwheel failure
phases.outcomeNarrative: Elena mentions that only three people have regular access to the workshop tools: herself, her apprentice Aldric, and the mill's elderly caretaker. Her eyes dart away when mentioning Aldric.

phases.name: Clear debris and repair the waterwheel
phases.description: Remove the obstructions and fix the damaged mechanism
phases.outcomeNarrative: With effort, you clear away the accumulated debris and use your tools to repair the damaged gears. The waterwheel groans back to life, water driving the mechanism once more. The mill's heart beats again.

investigations.completionNarrative: You've uncovered the truth behind the waterwheel's sabotage. The evidence points clearly to the culprit, and Elena now knows what happened to her mill.
